title: `PageData` and `PageServerData` only gets type if `load` destructure a property otherwise `unknown`
body:
### Describe the bug

The types `PageData` and `PageServerData` only gets types from the load function if the load function destructures a property. 
If the `load` function doesn't destructure a property the types become `unknown`.



### Reproduction

Clone https://github.com/Addeuz/sveltekit-no-types

- Do `npm install && npm run dev` so that `.svelte-kit` folder is generated
- Go the file `.svelte-kit/types/src/routes/todos/$types.d.ts`, see that `PageData` and `PageServerData` is unknown.
- Then go to the `+page.server.ts` file in the `todos` folder and destructure a property (for example `params`) then save the file.
- Then go back to the `$types.d.ts` file and now both `PageData` and `PageServerData` has types. (Correct ones even though stackblitz can't show them).

I'm not sure of the issue but what I'm noticing is that the `proxy+page.server.ts` file doesn't not get updated if there isn't a destructured property.

### Logs

_No response_

### System Info

```shell
System:
    OS: Linux 5.15 Ubuntu 20.04.4 LTS (Focal Fossa)
    CPU: (16) x64 AMD Ryzen 7 2700X Eight-Core Processor
    Memory: 19.68 GB / 31.28 GB
    Container: Yes
    Shell: 5.0.17 - /bin/bash
  Binaries:
    Node: 16.16.0 - /usr/bin/node
    Yarn: 1.22.15 - /usr/bin/yarn
    npm: 8.11.0 - /usr/bin/npm
  Browsers:
    Chrome: 103.0.5060.134
    Chromium: 104.0.5112.79
    Firefox: 103.0
  npmPackages:
    @sveltejs/adapter-auto: next => 1.0.0-next.64 
    @sveltejs/kit: next => 1.0.0-next.410 
    svelte: ^3.46.0 => 3.49.0 
    vite: ^3.0.0 => 3.0.8
```


### Severity

annoyance

### Additional Information

_No response_
